div.bibl: Sunday Jewish Courier, Mar. 18, 1923. HARRY BERNSTEIN'S CLOAKMAKERS FIRST TO GIVE TO H. I. A. S.

body.p: At a shop meeting of Harry Bernstein's cloakmakers, it was decided to give a day's wages to the H. I. A. S. (Hebrew Immigrant Aid Society). Mr. [Adolph] Copeland, president of the Chicago H.I.A.S., urged these workers to support the H. I. A. S. Harry Bernstein promised to give twice the amount raised by his workers.
